p: Some patients are detectd with definite disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) [ 69]. This DIC is primarily pro-thrombotic with high venous thromboembolism rate, increased D-dimer and fibrinogen levels, reduced anti-thrombin levels, pulmonary congestion with microvascular thrombosis and occlusion on pathology besides high rates of central line thrombosis and vascular occlusive events (e.g. ischemic limbs, strokes, etc.) [ 69].
